p: The effective doses (IC 50 and IC 90) are defined as the concentration of drug or extract producing 50% and 90%, respectively, inhibition on egg hatching or larval development. 28 Consequently, the three condensed tannin extracts in this study revealed a range of efficacies to inhibit egg hatching and larval development. The observed differences in potencies among the extracts might be associated with the corresponding variation in their tannin contents. Related work with the in vitro inhibitory effect of condensed tannins on egg hatchability and larval development of Haemonchus contortus was reported previously. 21
